title: Bug 124610 - Adding a filter on a boolean computed column causes an error
OB: When attempting to add a filter on a boolean computed column, an error is encountered.
EB: Filters on boolean computed columns should be applied without causing errors.
SR:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a new BIRT sample data source and a dataset from the 'orders' table.
2. Create a computed column named 'yes/no' with type 'any' (no boolean for choose), and set the value as follows: if (row[1] % 2 == 0) {true;} else {false;}
3. Drag the dataset from Data Explorer to Layout.
4. Select the table, navigate to the 'Filters' tab in the Property Editor.
5. Click the 'Add' button.
6. Choose 'yes/no' as the Expression and 'Is True' as the Operator.
